IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: FURTHER THE GENERAL WELFARE AND QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE JEWISH COMMUNITY, LOCALLY, IN ISRAEL, AND THROUGHOUT THE WORLD; TO RAISE AND DISBURSE FUNDS AND OTHERWISE PLAN FOR THE CHARITABLE, SOCIAL, CULTURAL, RELIGIOUS, AND EDUCATIONAL ADVANCEMENT OF THE JEWISH COMMUNITY, LOCALLY, IN ISRAEL, AND THROUGHOUT THE WORLD; AND TO FOSTER COOPERATION AMONG LOCAL JEWISH ORGANIZATIONS DEDICATED TO THESE PURPOSES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: FURTHER THE GENERAL WELFARE AND QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE JEWISH COMMUNITY, LOCALLY, IN ISRAEL, AND THROUGHOUT THE WORLD; TO RAISE AND DISBURSE FUNDS AND OTHERWISE PLAN FOR THE CHARITABLE, SOCIAL, CULTURAL, RELIGIOUS, AND EDUCATIONAL ADVANCEMENT OF THE JEWISH COMMUNITY, LOCALLY, IN ISRAEL, AND THROUGHOUT THE WORLD; AND TO FOSTER COOPERATION AMONG LOCAL JEWISH ORGANIZATIONS DEDICATED TO THESE PURPOSES.
IRS990.Desc: CAMP BEN FRANKEL IS A COED, OVERNIGHT, SUMMER CAMP FOR JEWISH CHILDREN AND TEENS LOCATED IN CARBONDALE, IL. SINCE 1949, OUR CAMPERS HAVE DEVELOPED LIFELONG FRIENDSHIPS AND DEEP CONNECTIONS TO JUDAISM AND ISRAEL. WITH ENROLLMENT LIMITED TO ONLY 100 CAMPERS, CHILDREN ENJOY A SMALL, PERSONAL COMMUNITY WITH LOTS OF INDIVIDUAL ATTENTION. ESTABLISHED AS A PROGRAM OF THE JEWISH FEDERATION OF SOUTHERN ILLINOIS, SOUTHEAST MISSOURI AND WESTERN KENTUCKY, FOR ALMOST 70 YEARS CAMP BEN FRANKEL HAS TOUCHED THE LIVES OF THOUSANDS OF JEWISH CHILDREN.IN 2017 CAMP BEN FRANKEL SERVED 80 CAMPERS AND 31 CAMP COUNSELORS. 46% IDENTIFIED AS COMING FROM A SMALL JEWISH COMMUNITY AND 44% OF PARENTS SAID CAMP WAS THEIR CHILD'S PRIMARY JEWISH EXPERIENCE. AFTER A SUMMER AT CAMP BEN FRANKEL, PARENTS REPORTED A PRONOUNCED DIFFERENCE IN THEIR CHILD'S JEWISH IDENTITY, CONNECTIONS TO JEWISH ROLE MODELS, AND CONNECTION TO ISRAEL.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUPPORT THE JEWISH FEDERATION AND ASSISTANCE FOR THE JEWISH COMMUNITY

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: DUE TO JEWISH FEDERATION OF NORTH AMERICA

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT EFFECTS OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ARE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WHEN IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT, BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS, THAT THE POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION. AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2017, THE ASSOCIATION HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART I, DOING BUSINESS AS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: JEWISH FEDERATION OF SOUTHERN ILLINOIS, SOUTHEAST MISSOURI AND WESTERN KENTUCKY

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE WAS A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE FOLLOWING BOARD MEMBERS: MALCOLM AND CAROL ZWICK BURTON, KEREN, MALCOLM AND CAROL ZWICK KAE AND LOREN COLLINS SANDOR AND CAROL KOREIN ELIZABETH AND LEONARD LINKON

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE OFFICERS SHALL BE ELECTED BY THE MEMBERS AT THE ANNUAL MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANY JEWISH PERSON WHO CONTRIBUTES TO THE JEWISH FEDERATION IN ANY CALENDAR YEAR, IPSO FACTO, SHALL BE A VOTING MEMBER OF THE FEDERATION FOR AND DURING THE CALENDAR YEAR IN WHICH SUCH CONTRIBUTION IS MADE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR FIRST AND THEN THE FINANCE COMMITTEE PRIOR TO FILING.

THERE WAS NO FORMAL PROCESS IN PLACE IN 2017 FOR THE BOARD MEMBERS AND EMPLOYEES TO COMPLETE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM. BEGINNING IN 2019, BOARD MEMBERS WILL BE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE RECOMMENDS COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND IT IS REVIEWED AND VOTED ON BY THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST
CAMP TEMPORARY STAFF: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 80,322. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 80,322.
THE ORGANIZATION USES MODIFIED CASH BASIS OF ACCOUNTING FOR THE TAX RETURN PREPARATION AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT TIMELY FILE THIS RETURN DUE TO THEIR CONCERN REGARDING THE NEED TO PRODUCE ACCURATE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS UPON WHICH TO BASE THE 990. NEW MANAGEMENT HIRED AN AUDIT FIRM SPECIALIZING IN NONPROFITS WHICH HELPED THEM TO CORRECT THEIR ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL REPORTING TO ADHERE MORE TO THE RULES GOVERNING NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THIS PROCESS REQUIRED ADDITIONAL TIME BEYOND WHAT WAS ANTICIPATED, BUT THE RESULTS WILL ENHANCE MANAGEMENT AND THE BOARD'S GOVERNANCE OVER THE ORGANIZATION. THE FEDERATION UNDERSTANDS ITS RESPONSIBILITY TO MEET ALL FILING REQUIREMENTS. NOW THAT THE ACCOUNTING HAS BEEN CORRECTED AND VARIOUS OPERATIONAL IMPROVEMENTS IMPLEMENTED, THERE WILL BE NO OBSTACLE TO TIMELY FILING GOING FORWARD.
